attributes.action: To quel incitement, dissipate racial hatred and harmonise community relation through a programme to develop greater understanding through peaceful, legal, legitimate means rather than non - endorsed community groups
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Further to : http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/Secularstate/

and given the findings of a yougov poll which reports : 

37% of 16 to 24-year-olds would prefer living under Sharia law than British law 

74% of 16 to 24-year-olds prefer Muslim women to choose to wear the hijab 

13% of 16 to 24-year-olds admire organisations like al-Qaeda that are prepared to FIGHT the West

33% of 16 to 24-year-olds believed that those converting﻿ to another 
religion should be EXECUTED

the petitioner is calling on the P.M. to define sharia law to the British electorate and explain what and who it represents : In a free democratic state, are it's bodies elected ? regulated ? held to account ? what are the constitutional articles and it's mission statement ? are the conventions of sharia law ratified ? Whilst the previous administration made headway in recognising human rights - including that to practise religious faith of whatever denomination - why does religion then become political ?
